thread.title: The Perpetual Pop-Up: A Dining Trend Digs In
thread.title_full: The Perpetual Pop-Up: A Dining Trend Digs In - WSJ

author: Jane Black
title: The Perpetual Pop-Up: A Dining Trend Digs In
text: DANNY NEWBERG knew just the kind of restaurant he wanted to open in New York: a classic seafood counter. He could picture it. About 30 seats with counter service, paper place mats that served as menus, bottles of hot sauce and paper napkins along the bar—a diner, but with spectacular food. While he hunted for a space, Mr. Newberg, who had cooked in a series of illustrious Manhattan kitchens—Momofuku Ko, Isa, Estela—made money running pop-up dinners at friends’ restaurants. He called his pop-up-producing business Joint... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
